does convert just get twin bed mattress ve heard positive things about just putting the crib mattress on the floor http www babysleepsite com sleep training montessori floor beds baby toddler sleep then would recommend twin bed that low to the ground twin toddler beds seem like waste of money all for crib mattress on the floor for bit and then twin bed you can also get rails for twin beds if necessary but we just stuck with low frame on the twin if you re near one ikea has beds that extend from toddler to twin definitely do the twin bed we used pool noodles under the fitted sheet on one side as cheaper version of guard rails and put the other side against the wall it worked great the only reason we got toddler bed at all is cause someone offered me one for 50 and we could just use the crib mattress they always seem poorly made and they grow out of them so fast you could always get bed rail if you are worried about him rolling out we first converted our crib into toddler bed he fell few times but quickly learned finally we just got him twin bed we figured we would only get so much mileage out of toddler bed and he does care either way he loves his new bed and has had no problem sleeping on it he does have any guard rails or step ladders and it has been an issue twin they grow so quickly no sense in wasting money on something you ll just have to replace we just skipped into full sized bed did want to waste money on twin when inevitably we upgrade to full since we were buying an entire bedroom suite not just the bed we bought it at haverty and while it was cheap it is also real wood and will last really really long time we borrowed toddler bed at 16m and at years our son went into king single bed love it as can snuggle in with him when he needs me my son is also tall at curve of around 110 it seems lol have full sized mattress on the floor he rolls lot and he still falls off of the full size tell that to my husband that been pining over jeep toddler bed since our son was like month old lol we did get toddler bed but it was more so my husbands idea she has more floor space in her room to play than having twin bed if you do go with twin though just do use the box spring put the mattress on the frame and call it good at that point it low enough that the baby wo hurt hisself if he falls we put folded blanket on the floor just in case now if our daughter rolls out she typically just crawls back into bed she not quite amp we put twin mattress on the floor with guard rail that gave us some room to lay with him for story time he is now in twin bed we bought bunk bed from craig list and we are using the top bed on its own it has rails on both sides we figure his little brother may eventually want to share rooms with him if not bunk bed is great for sleep overs just bought my year old toddler bed as needed her current toddler bed turned back into crib never planned on that and figured go straight to twin or full but as it turns out we still live in our small apartment and keeping toddler gives her so much more room when was doing research that pretty much what found people who have the room think toddler beds are waste of money and people who are in tighter spaces love them would def go to twin if you have the room though my son room is technically box room 190x195cm and just barely fits single bed we got one anyway as he does spend much time in there otherwise so space is concern plus he tall and heavy so figured the single bed would last him longer we got box spring with built in storage drawers so it quite we actually had mini crib so it an upgrade for her leaves room for playing in her room plus plan on using it when outgrows the mini crib spent like 75 on it maybe also had regular size crib mattress
